item.title: Billy Cobham On World Cafe
item.description: Hear the pioneering jazz drummer talk about his 40th-anniversary tour and working with Miles Davis.
item.content:encoded:
Hear the pioneering jazz drummer talk about his 40th-anniversary tour and working with Miles Davis.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Emmylou Harris And Rodney Crowell: Harmonizing To That 'Old Yellow Moon'
item.description: Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell have been friends and collaborators since they first met in 1974. While they always wanted to make an album together, they never got around to it until now. Old Yellow Moon includes songs by Crowell, Patti Scialfa, Johnny Cash, and Kris Kristofferson among others.
item.content:encoded:
Emmylou Harris and Rodney Crowell have been friends and collaborators since they first met in 1974. While they always wanted to make an album together, they never got around to it until now. Old Yellow Moon includes songs by Crowell, Patti Scialfa, Johnny Cash, and Kris Kristofferson among others.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Fresh Flavor For Your Ears: 7 New Latin Songs
item.description: This week on Alt.Latino, we do what we do best: share our favorite new music with you.
item.content:encoded:
This week on Alt.Latino, we do what we do best: share our favorite new music with you.

item.title: Train To Glory: A Gospel Music Mix
item.description: With Easter upon us, Cecilia Webb — host of Train to Glory on KUNM in Albuquerque, N.M. — takes us on a tour of the contemporary gospel music scene. For a limited time, listen to a continuous mix that touches on all corners of her collection.
item.content:encoded:
With Easter upon us, Cecilia Webb — host of Train to Glory on KUNM in Albuquerque, N.M. — takes us on a tour of the contemporary gospel music scene. For a limited time, listen to a continuous mix that touches on all corners of her collection.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: The Good News Is That We Know 'Idol' Is Really Live Now
item.description: A particularly meandering performance of "I Can't Help Myself" left a sour taste from Motown Night.
item.content:encoded:
A particularly meandering performance of "I Can't Help Myself" left a sour taste from Motown Night.

item.title: We Get Mail: The Power Of Pulling The Plug
item.description: Why do some songs just sound better when you strip away all of the frills?
item.content:encoded:
Why do some songs just sound better when you strip away all of the frills?

item.title: The Many Sounds Of 1993 Bay Area Rap
item.description: Overlooked by the industry, Bay Area rappers as different as E-40, Too Short and The Coup were free to make and sell music that didn't sound like anybody else's.
item.content:encoded:
Overlooked by the industry, Bay Area rappers as different as E-40, Too Short and The Coup were free to make and sell music that didn't sound like anybody else's.

item.title: Thistle And Shamrock: Canada
item.description: Travel to Cape Breton, Newfoundland, Prince Edward Island, Quebec and beyond to hear the authentic Celtic-rooted music of Canada with Leahy, Loreena McKennit, Mary Jane Lamond, Natalie MacMaster and more.
item.content:encoded:
Travel to Cape Breton, Newfoundland, Prince Edward Island, Quebec and beyond to hear the authentic Celtic-rooted music of Canada with Leahy, Loreena McKennit, Mary Jane Lamond, Natalie MacMaster and more.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Jeff Ballard Fairgrounds: Live At The Village Vanguard
item.description: With his ever-changing Fairgrounds band, the drummer gets to mix and match his favorite musicians. And when you've been tapped to play drums for Chick Corea, Ray Charles and Brad Mehldau, you get to know a lot of musicians. Ballard and a multi-generational band play live in New York.
item.content:encoded:
With his ever-changing Fairgrounds band, the drummer gets to mix and match his favorite musicians. And when you've been tapped to play drums for Chick Corea, Ray Charles and Brad Mehldau, you get to know a lot of musicians. Ballard and a multi-generational band play live in New York.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Live At Carnegie Hall: Jonathan Biss and The Elias String Quartet
item.description: In an art form filled with tortured souls, Robert Schumann stands out — even more than 150 years after his death. Hear one of America's finest young pianists and an emerging English string quartet play music by the visionary composer, as well as music by Mozart and artists Schumann influenced.
item.content:encoded:
In an art form filled with tortured souls, Robert Schumann stands out — even more than 150 years after his death. Hear one of America's finest young pianists and an emerging English string quartet play music by the visionary composer, as well as music by Mozart and artists Schumann influenced.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Wanda Jackson On World Cafe
item.description: Hear the queen of rockabilly perform songs from her 31st studio album, Unfinished Business, and discuss the differences in her collaborations with Jack White and Justin Townes Earle.
item.content:encoded:
Hear the queen of rockabilly perform songs from her 31st studio album, Unfinished Business, and discuss the differences in her collaborations with Jack White and Justin Townes Earle.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Ashley Paul Incites A Microscopic Riot On 'Watch Them Pass'
item.description: The Brooklyn-via-Boston composer and multi-instrumentalist is used to making a huge racket, but here she finds melancholy in still simplicity.
item.content:encoded:
The Brooklyn-via-Boston composer and multi-instrumentalist is used to making a huge racket, but here she finds melancholy in still simplicity.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: First Watch: Phosphorescent, 'Song For Zula'
item.description: The new video for Phosphorescent's "Song For Zula" wraps metaphorical chains around a story of heartbreak.
item.content:encoded:
The new video for Phosphorescent's "Song For Zula" wraps metaphorical chains around a story of heartbreak.

item.title: KCRW Presents: Cold War Kids
item.description: The California band recently released its fourth album, Dear Miss Lonelyhearts. Watch them perform the bluesy new song "Tuxedo," which has conquered the KCRW chart.
item.content:encoded:
The California band recently released its fourth album, Dear Miss Lonelyhearts. Watch them perform the bluesy new song "Tuxedo," which has conquered the KCRW chart.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Surfer Blood: NPR Front Row
item.description: Surfer Blood fans still have to wait a few months to hear its second album, Pythons, but the Florida band gave a preview of the record during shows at SXSW this year. Watch the group perform "Demon Dance" at the Warner Sound party at the Belmont in Austin, Texas.
item.content:encoded:
Surfer Blood fans still have to wait a few months to hear its second album, Pythons, but the Florida band gave a preview of the record during shows at SXSW this year. Watch the group perform "Demon Dance" at the Warner Sound party at the Belmont in Austin, Texas.
